Ahoy!

I am Niklas, a UX guy that combines passion in psychology, human-centered design, accessibility and technology to improve the impact of Nonprofits.

I help good organizations create products and services that people need (and love), products that have a good impact on their mission and the world. I do this through smart research, experience, and psychology. I live in Schwerin, Northern Germany. It’s pretty nice here; I think you’d like it.

Check out the services I offer, to learn how I can help you to do good better.

I’m in it for good: My focus is on delivering projects for organizations or companies that strive to do good work. Green, animals, education, humanitarian, social, or ethical.

In my blog I write about opinions and ideas on UX and technology, and it’s effect on our world. Here are some of my latest thoughts:

  • The Negativity Bias in User Experience
  • The God Login
  • UX Day 2014 – A recap

Sounds good? Drop me a line! I ramble on Twitter, show my work on Dribbble, share my code on Github, network on LinkedIn, and stream my life’s soundtrack on Spotify.
